#Text=John of Gloucester
#Text=John of Gloucester ( or John of Pontefract ) ( 1468 – 1499 ( based on historical hypothesis ) ) was a son of King Richard III of England .
#Text=John is so called because his father was Duke of Gloucester at the time of his birth .
#Text=His father appointed him Captain of Calais , a position he lost after his father 's death .
#Text=He seems to have been held in custody at some point during the reign of Henry VII and may have been executed around 1499 .
#Text=Early life
#Text=The identity of John 's mother is not known , nor is his date of birth .

#Text=However , since Katherine , Richard III 's other illegitimate child , was old enough to be wedded in 1484 and John was old enough to be knighted in September 1483 in York Minster ( when his half brother Edward , Richard 's only legitimate heir , was invested Prince of Wales ) and to be made Captain of Calais in March 1485 , most historians agree these 2 children were fathered during Richard 's teen years . [ 1 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=There is no trace of infidelity on Richard 's part after his marriage in 1472 , when he was around 20 . [ 3 ]

#Text=Dr Ashdown-Hill suggests that John was conceived during Richard 's first solo expedition to the eastern counties in the summer of 1467 at the invitation of John Howard and that the boy was born in 1468 and named after his friend and supporter .

#Text=Richard himself noted John was still a minor ( not being yet 21 ) when he issued the royal patent appointing him Captain of Calais on 11 March 1485 , possibly on his seventeenth birthday . [ 4 ]
#Text=An order referring to his appointment as Captain of Calais calls him " John de Pountfreit Bastard .

#Text=His letter of appointment has Richard referring to him as  our dear bastard son " .

column1: #Text=The patent appointing John gave him all of the necessary powers of his position , except of appointing officers , which it reserved until he turned twenty-one ; it does not indicate how close to turning twenty-one he was .
#Text=A warrant dated 9 March 1485 to deliver clothing to " the Lord Bastard " probably refers to John . [ 10 ]
#Text=Under Henry VII

#Text=After Richard was killed in the Battle of Bosworth Field ( 22 August 1485 ) , Henry VII removed John from the position of Captain of Calais , but did not further persecute him and , on 1 March 1486 , granted him an annual income of 20 pounds sterling . [ 11 ]
#Text=In his confession , Perkin Warbeck stated that when he began his impersonation of Richard , Duke of York , in 1491 , " King Richard 's bastard son was in the hands of the king of England .

#Text=In the seventeenth century , an early defender of Richard III , George Buck , claimed that around the time of the executions of Warbeck and Edward , Earl of Warwick , in 1499 ,  there was a base son of King Richard III made away , and secretly , having been kept long before in prison .
